title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4202.7 - Form of commission orders
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4202.7 - Form of commission orders

State Regulations

Whenever the commission has adopted a rule or regulation
or has rendered a decision, whether on appeal or otherwise, or made an order or
directive, the signature of any of the commissioners or the chairman shall be
sufficient, however, such signature shall not be required if the secretary of
the commission shall certify to the decision, order or directive and his
signature on such written order or any form of determination, or on any
promulgation thereof, shall be valid and effective as evidencing the official
action taken by the commission. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4202.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
